en: Just because there aren't any complaints, doesn't necessarily mean your customers are content.

en: Young Tanaka is the stupidest person in the department.

en: Deposed in a military coup in September 2006 and having effectively been in exile, the Former premier of Thailand Thaksin has returned after about a year and a half.

en: It has become clear what murder-suspect Miura's jail lifestyle is like.
zh: 杀人嫌犯三浦在牢里的生活状况现在已经清楚了。

en: I'm in transit between flights now. I've spent 8 hours on a plane so far, after changing planes now it's another two hours.
zh: 我现在正在转机。已经坐了8个小时飞机了，换乘之后还得再坐两个小时。

en: "How is her condition?" "She must have absolute bed rest."
zh: “她情况怎么样？”“她必须卧床静养。”

en: It's nothing to do with me, equals, I don't have to be here. So I'm getting out of here, whatever anybody says!
zh: 这事儿跟我没关系，也就是说我没必要待在这儿。所以管别人怎么说，我要走了！

en: Now Beth enters, stage right!
zh: 现在贝丝从舞台右侧上场！

en: That's because I don't suppose anybody will believe this story.
zh: 那是因为我觉得这故事估计没人会信。

en: OK, stop there! That was a strong performance from the two of you.
zh: 好，停！你们两个表现得很出色。

en: At first, I thought they were sick.
zh: 起初，我还以为他们病了。

en: At first, I thought I was sick.
zh: 起初，我还以为我病了。

en: At first, I thought he was sick.
zh: 起初，我还以为他病了。

en: At first, I thought she was sick.
zh: 起初，我还以为她病了。

en: It's not as if he can't run fast.
zh: 他又不是跑不快。

en: It's not that he can't run fast.
zh: 他并不是跑不快。

en: I became accustomed to public speaking, so I think that's been useful when taking job interviews.
zh: 我习惯了在公众面前讲话，所以我觉得这对面试挺有帮助的。

en: Come to pick me up if it rains tomorrow.
zh: 如果明天下雨的话，来接我一下。

en: My head is swimming, so I'll try writing any-old stuff without any deep thought.
zh: 我现在脑子里乱糟糟的，就随手写点东西，不去深想了。

en: However, the survivors are unaware of that fact.
zh: 然而，幸存者们并不知道那个事实。

en: After being told, "Please, sit down," I sit in the chair.
zh: 听到对方说“请坐”后，我就坐到了椅子上。

en: I was very happy to see you at the offline-party.
zh: 在线下聚会上见到你，我真的很开心。

en: It should be decided in the next day or two.
zh: 这一两天内应该就能定下来。

en: With the subjunctive past all the 'be' verbs become 'were', OK?
zh: 在虚拟语气过去式里，be 动词都要变成 were，明白吗？

en: That man's monstrously strong.
zh: 那家伙力气大得惊人。

en: "Mr Chairman, what needs moving next, again?" "Scoreboard, giant ball and the tug-of-war rope."
zh: “主席，接下来还要搬什么？”“计分板、大球，还有拔河用的绳子。”

en: That's a clear case of "water off a duck's back".
zh: 那简直就是“耳边风”。

en: I felt it was a relatively difficult jigsaw puzzle.
zh: 我觉得这拼图还挺难的。

en: I took care to make the letters large and be generous with character and line spacing in order for it to be easy to read for the elderly and those who have problems with their sight.
zh: 为了方便老人和视力不好的人阅读，我特意把字写得很大，还加大了字间距和行间距。

en: Oh, while I remember, it seems that that was a bug that occurs when you use the comment field's 'letter-spacing' tag which adjusts the tracking.
zh: 噢，我想起来了，那好像是使用评论栏的 letter-spacing 标签调整字间距时出现的 bug。

en: Ah, now I remember. I used a condom; something I rarely, or rather practically never, do.
zh: 啊，我想起来了。我戴了避孕套，这事我很少干，或者说几乎从不干。

en: "Ow-ow-ouch" "Are you alright?"
zh: “哎哟，疼疼疼……”“你没事吧？”

en: I'm not a university student, but I'm brighter than them.
zh: 我虽然不是大学生，但我比他们聪明多了。

en: You're students - It's only now what you can do this sort of thing.
zh: 你们是学生，也就现在能做这种事。

en: 'Childhood friends' are scary.
zh: “青梅竹马”什么的真可怕。

en: The problem quoted isn't one, but there are problems in the reading section that ask you to distinguish relative pronouns from relative adverbs.
zh: 刚才举的那个例子不是，但在阅读部分里确实有要求区分关系代词和关系副词的题。

en: Companions with the same aim, to carve out their own future, cooperate with each other.
zh: 为了开创属于自己的未来，志同道合的伙伴们互相协作。

en: I tilt my head. Not the pawn, but the knight?
zh: 我歪了歪头。不走兵，走马？

en: I moved a chess piece on the board one forward.
zh: 我把棋盘上的棋子往前挪了一步。

en: I just don't understand what goes through the minds of people who troll forums.
zh: 我真不明白那些在论坛上故意抬杠的人是怎么想的。

en: The verb 'help' takes to-infinitives and bare infinitives but bare infinitives are said to be the most common in casual text; as also used in this example sentence.
zh: 动词 help 后面可以接带 to 的不定式或不带 to 的不定式，但在日常表达中，不带 to 的不定式更常见，就像这个例句一样。

en: Please, by all means, drop in when you go shopping.
zh: 购物的时候一定要顺便过来坐坐啊。

en: Ah, unfortunately there is a small matter I need to attend to so I'll take my leave now.
zh: 啊，真不巧，我还有点小事要处理，就先失陪了。

en: The tiger, having had its wounds treated, was returned by the villagers to the animal sanctuary without incident.
zh: 那只老虎治好伤后，被村民们平平安安地送回了野生动物保护区。

en: It takes a long time to convert.
zh: 转换需要很长时间。

en: That can't be good for your health, can it?
zh: 那样对身体可没好处，对吧？

en: From children to the elderly, sensible exercise has a good effect on the body.
zh: 无论是小孩还是老人，适量运动都对身体有好处。

en: I think that it likely that there was a major fault in the lookout.
zh: 我觉得哨位那边很可能出了大问题。

en: Anything like a road was covered with water that had flooded out of the river.
zh: 路都被河里漫出来的水给淹了。

en: "Eh? Is the tangent cosine divided by sine?" "Other way round!"
zh: “诶？正切是余弦除以正弦吗？”“弄反了！”

en: Actually, and I need to keep this quiet, but recently here there's a rumour that young women on this beach are having photos taken in secret of them.
zh: 那个，我得小声点说，最近有传闻说这片沙滩上有年轻女孩被偷拍。

en: I couldn't help overhearing, but you're police officers who handle cyber-crime or some such?
zh: 我刚才不小心听到了，你们是负责网络犯罪之类的警察吗？

en: Then, those from a year ago won't be working any more!
zh: 那一年多前的那些就不管用了吧！

en: The future progressive tense is used when expressing events and action in progress at some future point, however the example sentence cannot be understood in that way.
zh: 将来进行时是用来表达未来某个时间点正在发生的动作，但这个例句不能这么理解。

en: Well, shall we call it a day?
zh: 好了，今天就先到这儿吧？

en: I'd like to say a word of thanks to all those gentlemen and ladies whose care I have been in.
zh: 我想向一直以来照顾我的各位表示感谢。

en: Isn't it a mild winter this year? Makes life easier.
zh: 今年是个暖冬吧？日子好过多了。

en: "Lemme see your painting, Manaka." "Must you? It's embarrassing!"
zh: “真中，给我看看你的画。”“一定要看吗？好难为情啊！”

en: Investing abroad on your national currency basis will not always be profitable.
zh: 以本币为基准进行海外投资并不总是盈利的。

en: Omission is a perfectly good example of an expression technique, and is brought up in many grammar books.
zh: 省略也是一种很好的表达技巧，很多语法书里都提到了。

en: I wonder if you can sue someone of the same sex for sexual harassment?
zh: 我在想，同性之间也能告性骚扰吗？

en: There's gum stuck to the back of my shoe.
zh: 我鞋底粘了块口香糖。

en: Is it the vacuum cleaner's fault that the room is dusty?
zh: 房间里灰尘多，难道是吸尘器的错？

en: The flowers don't look happy. I'd like to water them. Is there a watering can?
zh: 这些花看着没精神，我想浇点水。有喷壶吗？

en: The flowers don't look well. I'd like to water them. Is there a watering can?
zh: 这些花看着不太好，我想给它们浇点水。这儿有洒水壶吗？

en: This carving knife ... it's one made by a famous swordsmith.
zh: 这把刻刀……是出自名家之手的。

en: Recently there have been a lot of nasty incidents with fraud.
zh: 最近诈骗案挺多的，挺恶心的。

en: Recently there are a lot of young people who don't use respectful language to their superiors.
zh: 最近很多年轻人对长辈说话都不用敬语。

en: I also gave him a little something as a Christmas present the other day.
zh: 前几天我也送了他一点小东西当圣诞礼物。

en: We're one baton short for the relay.
zh: 我们接力赛少了一个接力棒。

en: Oh? You can type without looking at the keyboard. That's cool!
zh: 哟？你居然能盲打。真厉害！

en: "Well, there's something I'd like your advice on about my research project ..." "Let's see... Hmm, you're investigating flowering plants then."
zh: “内个，关于我的研究课题，我想请教您一下……”“我看看……嗯，你在研究开花植物啊。”

en: "You don't get on well with your father?" "..." "Sorry, that was none of my business."
zh: “你跟你爸关系不好吗？”“……”“抱歉，我不该多嘴的。”

en: "Let's head back." "Shall we drop by McDonald's?"
zh: “咱们回去吧。”“要顺路去趟麦当劳吗？”

en: Karaoke, TV games, videos and a fridge ... love hotels nowadays really have everything.
zh: 卡拉OK、电视游戏、视频还有冰箱……现在的情趣旅馆真是应有尽有。

en: The novel I'm writing next is set in a love hotel so I wanted to see what one actually looks like.
zh: 我下一部小说是以情趣旅馆为背景的，所以我想来看看实际长什么样。

en: I wonder why tennis is played in mini-skirts.
zh: 我在想为什么打网球要穿超短裙。

en: I wonder why we play tennis in miniskirts.
zh: 我在想咱们打网球为什么要穿迷你裙。

en: Carbon monoxide is a poisonous substance formed by the incomplete combustion of carbon compounds.
zh: 一氧化碳是含碳化合物不完全燃烧产生的一种有毒物质。

en: To be a good child, you need to go to bed and get up early.
zh: 想当个乖孩子，就得早睡早起。

en: In my daily life I take care in various ways of my body so as not to damage my health.
zh: 我平时很注意保养身体，免得把身体搞坏。

en: Ah, hold a mo. My shoelace's come undone.
zh: 哎，等一下。我鞋带开了。

en: In the official question collection it is explained as being "passive voice of the present continuous tense".
zh: 官方题库里的解释是“现在进行时的被动语态”。

en: When night fell, she watched the moon.
zh: 天黑了，她望着月亮。

en: At night, she gazed at the moon.
zh: 晚上，她凝视着月亮。

en: "Aki's off school today?" "It seems her cold got worse."
zh: “小亚纪今天没上学吗？”“好像是感冒加重了。”

en: "It's pool-season from this week, isn't it?" "Oh yes. I've gotta go and buy a swimming suit, then."
zh: “这周开始就是游泳季了吧？”“对哦，那我也得去买件泳衣了。”

en: I have trouble taking powdered medicine.
zh: 我不太会吃粉末状的药。

en: You know this textbook is made of recycled paper.
zh: 你知道这本教科书是用再生纸做的吧。

en: You're really the best when, and only when, it comes to angering people.
zh: 要说气死人的本事，你还真是没人能比。

en: You know about 'ra-skipped words'? It looks like quite a lot of students are using mistaken words.
zh: 你知道“ら拔音节”现象吗？好像挺多学生都用错词了。

zh: “怎么了？看你坐立不安的。”“呃，那个，我裤子皮筋好像松了。”

en: That fact becomes self evident if you take a look at the relation between this theme and those leading research on it.
zh: 只要看看这个课题和那些顶尖研究之间的关系，事实就不言而喻了。

en: And so the method that works is treading down the snow to harden it, making blocks and piling them up.
zh: 所以有效的办法就是把雪踩实，做成雪砖，再垒起来。

en: If we're going to play, make your mind up about the rules!
zh: 要玩的话，先把规则定好啊！

en: It's difficult to tell which is which for burnable and non-burnable rubbish as well, isn't it?
zh: 可燃垃圾和不可燃垃圾也挺难分的，对吧？

en: Fudge! My stocking's run.
zh: 糟了！我丝袜勾丝了。

en: If you mess-up it can't be redone, so don't mess-up!
zh: 搞砸了就没法重来了，所以千万别搞砸！

en: Anastrophe, by switching around words, has the effect of emphasizing text.
zh: 倒装语序通过调换词位，能起到强调文本的作用。

en: Today we will carry out an experiment about Ohm's Law.
zh: 今天我们要做一个关于欧姆定律的实验。

en: That 'Ayumi' kid, only 13 but has performed in movies and theatres as a child actor since she was five.
zh: 那个叫“步美”的孩子，才13岁，但从5岁起就作为童星演电影和话剧了。

en: The grammar section includes the passive voice of the present perfect.
zh: 语法部分包括了现在完成时的被动语态。

en: There are two ways of using the infinitive as an adjective, 1. attributive, 2. predicative. Naturally 2. is a subject complement.
zh: 不定式作形容词有两种用法：1. 定语，2. 表语。显然，2是主语补足语。

en: Things that modify nouns (adjective, or adjectival equivalent).
zh: 修饰名词的东西（形容词，或相当于形容词的短语）。

en: You're having so much fun doing what you are that you can't see what's going on around you.
zh: 你玩得太嗨了，连周围发生了什么都看不见了。

en: I serve pub food to Canadian customers.
zh: 我在酒吧给加拿大客人上菜。

en: As cultural exchange continued between the two countries, their mutual understanding became even deeper.
zh: 随着两国间文化交流的持续，彼此的了解也更加深入了。

en: When a coil is moved near to a wire with current flowing in it current flows in the coil as well.
zh: 当线圈靠近有电流通过的导线时，线圈里也会产生电流。

en: It was going to be from Saturday, but, with one thing and another, it ended up being from the new week.
zh: 本来打算周六开始的，但因为各种杂事，最后改到了下周。

en: I think you fall well within 'cute girl'. You'd easily go and pass in his judgement.
zh: 我觉得你完全算得上是“萌妹子”，在他那儿绝对能过关。

en: Causing competitors to fail, obtaining confidential information, something that big business just can't do without - high risk but at the same time high return work.
zh: 搞垮竞争对手、获取机密情报，这些大企业少不了的勾当——高风险但同时也高回报的工作。

en: About four years ago my Achilles tendon started to hurt and I was told it was Achilles tendonitis.
zh: 大约四年前，我的跟腱开始疼，医生说是跟腱炎。

en: Let's go to eat together.
zh: 我们一起去吃饭吧。

en: In the midst of the dollar falling hard against the Yen and other major Eastern currencies the Chinese Yuan, with China effectively taking a 'dollar peg' policy, has become cheap.
zh: 在美元兑日元等主要东方货币大跌的情况下，由于中国实际上采取了“挂钩美元”的政策，人民币也变得很便宜。

en: He has the capacity to be a future leader of the nation.
zh: 他有潜力成为未来的国家领导人。

en: It is even becoming accepted even in exam-English that that called "simple future tense" does not exist.
zh: 甚至在应试英语里，大家也开始接受所谓的“一般将来时”并不存在这一说法了。

en: Tyrannical governments frequently gaol their political opponents.
zh: 暴政政府经常监禁政敌。

en: Tyrannical governments frequently imprison their political opponents.
zh: 专制政府经常把政治对手关进监狱。

en: Tyrannical governments frequently put their political opponents in prison.
zh: 独裁政府经常把政敌关进大牢。

en: Among the people of the colonies suffering under Earth's tyranny a force emerges intending to overthrow the status quo through terrorism.
zh: 在忍受地球暴政的殖民地人民中，出现了一股试图通过恐怖手段推翻现状的势力。

en: There are many uses of the 'present tense' of Japanese grammar which indicate things yet to happen.
zh: 日语语法里的“现在时”有很多用法是用来表示还没发生的事情的。

en: Fuck you!
zh: 去你的！

en: Die!
zh: 去死吧！

en: Go to hell!
zh: 见鬼去吧！

en: Language has, at the same time as being method of expressing one's thoughts, the side of being something used to think with.
zh: 语言在作为表达思想的手段的同时，也有作为思考工具的一面。

en: A light lunch at MacD's, coffee at Starbucks, then a few drinks with shabu-shabu - that's the way it went.
zh: 麦当劳吃个简餐，星巴克喝杯咖啡，再吃顿涮锅喝点小酒——那天就是这么过的。

en: "You'll get your clothes dirty." "No worries. They weren't very clean in the first place."
zh: “你会把衣服弄脏的。”“没事儿，本来也不怎么干净。”

en: Moreover, for your safety, we advise use of a substitute email address.
zh: 此外，为了您的安全，我们建议使用备用邮箱地址。

en: I switch on my laptop, start up the browser, and type in the address I've already learnt by heart.
zh: 我打开笔记本电脑，启动浏览器，输入那个我早就背熟了的地址。

en: About today's packed-lunch, the menus prepared by Itsuki and Tanaka are low in beta-carotene-rich vegetables again aren't they?
zh: 关于今天的便当，树和田中准备的菜单里，富含β-胡萝卜素的蔬菜是不是又很少啊？

en: I buy the texts, but first I start writing the English sentences that come along without looking at them.
zh: 我买了课本，但我会先不看书，直接试着写出里面的英文句子。

en: It's OK to think of 'five minutes' as a noun phrase, right?
zh: 把“五分钟”看作名词短语没问题吧？

en: If she gets some antibiotics and sleeps, she'll get better.
zh: 她要是吃点抗生素再睡一觉，就会好起来的。

en: I'd like to set up a sign like, "This Way ->," but what would it be if I made it in English?
zh: 我想竖个牌子，写着“这边走 ->”，但要是换成英文该怎么写呢？

en: Thank you for your business. Please come again!
zh: 谢谢惠顾，欢迎下次光临！

en: Gelatine has the property of setting as it cools.
zh: 明胶具有冷却后凝固的特性。

en: Along the way will be fine. It's a complicated matter.
zh: 路上再说吧，这事儿挺复杂的。

en: I've found something amazing!
zh: 我发现了个了不得的东西！

en: In which case, I was also requested to invite all of you so if you would please accompany me...
zh: 既然这样，我也被委托邀请各位，那就请随我来吧……

en: Whenever I go to a Japanese restaurant, I take the disposable chopsticks home with me.
zh: 每次去日料店，我都会把一次性筷子带回家。

en: Before adding a new sentence, please check that your sentence brings new vocabulary by searching the keywords.
zh: 在添加新句子之前，请先搜索关键词，确认你的句子是否带来了新词汇。

en: He chose the wrong man to pick a fight with.
zh: 他惹错人了。

en: Born on 2006 Feb 23, at 2730g, our family's treasure.
zh: 2006年2月23日出生，重2730克，是我们家的小宝贝。

en: You could at least try to be a bit more polite, even though it's not like you.
zh: 哪怕不像你的作风，你也起码试着礼貌一点嘛。

en: We've destroyed the enemy flagship!
zh: 我们击毁了敌方的旗舰！

en: "Take a look at this." "Eh?" "There's an impact mark on the right-hand side of the bumper."
zh: “你瞧这个。”“嗯？”“保险杠右边有个撞痕。”

en: First, let us talk about the experiments conducted in laboratories.
zh: 首先，让我们谈谈在实验室里进行的实验。

en: For circumstantial evidence, that's plenty.
zh: 作为间接证据，这些已经足够了。

en: Everyone must learn on their own in the end.
zh: 每个人最后都得靠自己去学习。

en: It's a typo. Sorry.
zh: 打错字了，抱歉。

en: This expression has really caught my fancy, as a type of English metaphorical expression not in Japanese.
zh: 我挺中意这个表达的，日语里没有这种英语式的隐喻。

en: This sort of structure is called a double negative, but in effect it shows affirmation.
zh: 这种结构叫双重否定，但实际上表示肯定。

en: I also really had the feeling of having had a relaxed day with my family for the first time in a long while.
zh: 我也感觉好久没跟家人这么轻松地过上一天了。

en: What should I do if I become depressed while studying abroad?
zh: 留学的时候要是抑郁了该怎么办？

en: Everyone, please keep to netiquette.
zh: 各位，请遵守网络礼仪。

en: We've taken a hit. Trivial damage.
zh: 中招了。不过只是轻微伤。

en: Present-day Japan is going down the route to self destruction, isn't it?
zh: 现在的日本正走在自取灭亡的路上，不是吗？

en: Shh, you're speaking too loudly.
zh: 嘘，你说话太大声了。

en: You're not going to get electrocuted just by directly touching a 1.5V battery.
zh: 直接摸1.5伏的电池是不会触电的。

en: However, maybe from the sudden change in pressure when you put them, having your ears pop is a problem.
zh: 不过，戴上时气压的突变会让耳朵不舒服，这倒是个问题。

en: Forget it. He is our mutual friend, after all.
zh: 算了吧，他毕竟是我们共同的朋友。

en: Stop it. He's our friend, isn't he?
zh: 住手吧。他可是咱们的朋友啊。

en: Conjugation of irregular verbs - essential for those learning English.
zh: 不规则动词变位——学英语的人必须掌握。

en: Take it seriously! The school festival won't wait for us. We're already in the final countdown.
zh: 认真点！校庆可不会等咱们，现在已经进入最后倒计时了。

en: ... Hey-hey you two, is it no holds barred as soon as you know it's my treat?
zh: ……喂喂，你们两个，一听说我请客就开始毫不客气了吗？

en: I don't think that they are valuable just because they have a large crop, but I'm glad when they sprout in great numbers - even when they are poison mushrooms.
zh: 我不觉得产量大就有价值，但看到它们大量长出来我还是挺开心的——哪怕是毒蘑菇。

en: Of course you can't say that it's worth nothing because it isn't perfect, so that doesn't mean that GTD is useless.
zh: 当然你不能因为不完美就说它一文不值，所以这并不代表GTD没用。

en: The relative pronoun 'that' has two states, a nominative case and objective case, but there is no possessive case.
zh: 关系代词“that”有主格和宾格，但没有所有格。

en: One of the greatest hurdles facing middle school students learning English is relative pronouns.
zh: 初中生学英语的一大难关就是关系代词。

en: Two weeks after being admitted to hospital my acne suddenly started to disappear.
zh: 住院两周后，我的粉刺突然就开始消失了。

en: I was locked out! There's got to be something fishy going on.
zh: 我被锁在门外了！这事儿绝对有鬼。

en: When the antecedent is this, that, these or those it is usual to use 'which'.
zh: 当先行词是this、that、these或those时，通常使用“which”。

en: The choice of example sentence wasn't wise.
zh: 这个例句选得不太高明。

en: With verbs there are intransitive verbs that don't take an object, and transitive verbs that do take an object.
zh: 动词分为不接宾语的不及物动词和接宾语的及物动词。

en: The book shop also looks like it closes late.
zh: 那家书店看起来关门也挺晚的。

en: A complete intransitive verb takes neither complement nor object.
zh: 完全不及物动词既不需要补语也不需要宾语。

en: Apparently in this library are precious books that money can't buy.
zh: 听说这家图书馆里有些花钱也买不到的珍贵藏书。

en: Among my cousins, you know, there's a girl with the most enormous breasts.
zh: 你知道吗，我那些表亲里，有个女孩子胸部特别大。

en: An English-Japanese dictionary is surely a must have book, not just for those taking TOEIC, but for all studying English.
zh: 英日词典绝对是必备书，不只是考托业的人，所有学英语的人都得有。

en: There are grammar books that call these sorts of things, not modifiers, but adjuncts (A).
zh: 有些语法书不把这类词叫修饰语，而叫状语（A）。

en: In a progressive tense sentence it becomes the -ing form verb, that is the present participle.
zh: 在进行时态的句子中，动词要变成ing形式，也就是现在分词。

en: The example is a past progressive tense sentence. How was everybody taught when they were learning about progressive tense?
zh: 这个例子是过去进行时。大家以前学进行时的时候，老师是怎么教的？

en: 'can' is an auxiliary verb, so in question sentences it is brought to the start of the phrase.
zh: “can”是情态动词，所以在疑问句里要提到句首。

en: Next, let us think about whether we have the time to look after a dog.
zh: 下面，咱们来考虑一下有没有时间养狗。

en: This a recent photo?
zh: 这是近照？

en: Is this a recent photo?
zh: 这是最近拍的照片吗？

en: In the cold season when you want to drink something hot I recommend this sort of thermos flask.
zh: 天冷想喝热饮的时候，我推荐这种保温瓶。

en: The present password is "eosdigital".
zh: 现在的密码是“eosdigital”。

en: Happy birthday, Miss Aiba!
zh: 相叶小姐，生日快乐！

en: By the way, today is the 8th of June — my wife's birthday.
zh: 对了，今天是6月8号，我老婆的生日。

en: Recently I've stopped being afraid of "living in shame" and being exposed to "public ridicule".
zh: 最近我不再害怕什么“丢人现眼”或是“出洋相”了。

en: I know that interest rates are fixed in accordance to the borrower's business risk.
zh: 我知道利率是根据借款人的经营风险来确定的。

en: When I inquired "what is that?" I was told, "go and find out for yourself."
zh: 当我问“那是啥？”的时候，别人告诉我“你自己去查”。

en: I have to get to sleep! I've got classes tomorrow.
zh: 我得睡觉了！明天还有课呢。

en: In hard times, in sorrowful times, let's try doing something for other people.
zh: 在困难和痛苦的时候，试着去为别人做点什么吧。

en: All those bastards do is complain.
zh: 那帮混蛋就知道抱怨。

en: Our experimental results left something to be desired.
zh: 我们的实验结果有些不尽如人意。
